verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; after the manner of Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. My soul <WH5315> waiteth <WH1747> in silence for God <WH430> only <WH3444>: From him cometh my salvation.
He only is my rock <WH6697> and my salvation <WH3444>: He is my high tower <WH4869>; I shall not be greatly <WH7227> moved <WH4131>.
How long will ye set upon <WH2050> a man <WH376>, That ye may slay <WH7523> him <WH5186>, all of you, Like a leaning wall <WH7023>, like a tottering <WH1760> fence <WH1447>?

They only consult <WH3289> to thrust him down <WH5080> from his dignity <WH7613>; They delight <WH7521> in lies <WH3577>; They bless <WH1288> with their mouth <WH6310>, but they curse <WH7043> inwardly <WH7130>. <WH5542>[[Selah
My soul <WH5315>, wait <WH1826> thou in silence for God <WH430> only <WH8615>; For my expectation is from him.
He only is my rock <WH6697> and my salvation <WH3444>: He is my high tower <WH4869>; I shall not be moved <WH4131>.
With God <WH430> is my salvation <WH3468> and my glory <WH3519>: The rock <WH6697> of my strength <WH5797>, and my refuge <WH4268>, is in God <WH430>.
Trust <WH982> in him at all times <WH6256>, ye people <WH5971>; Pour out <WH8210> your heart <WH3824> before <WH6440> him <WH430>: God is a refuge <WH4268> for us <WH5542>. [[Selah

Surely men <WH120> of low degree are vanity <WH1892>, and men <WH376> of high degree are a lie <WH3577>: In <WH5927> the balances <WH3976> they will go up <WH3162>; They are together lighter than vanity <WH1892>.
Trust <WH982> not in oppression <WH6233>, And become not vain <WH1891> in robbery <WH1498>: If riches <WH2428> increase <WH5107>, set <WH7896> not your heart thereon <WH3820>.
God <WH430> hath spoken <WH1696> once <WH259>, Twice <WH8147> have I heard <WH8085> this <WH2098>, That power <WH5797> belongeth unto God <WH430>.
Also unto thee <WH136>, O Lord, belongeth lovingkindness <WH2617>; For thou renderest <WH7999> to every man <WH376> according to his work <WH4639>.
